newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street seen opening flat to higher.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street seen opening flat to higher.

text.p: Wall Street stocks could open flat to higher Monday, bolstered by encouraging earnings reports, analysts said.
The long bond was off 1/32 to yield 7.17 percent. The Standard & Poor's 500 futures index was up 2.15 at 740.60.
"The S&P futures are on the upside and we're likely to have a market helped by good earnings reports," said Alan Ackerman, market strategist at Fahnestock & Co.
Among companies reporting, Coca-Cola Co's first quarter earnings per share were $0.40 against a First Call consensus estimate of $0.38.
